Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 10th overall pick, by Ashburn in 1979...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/1984, off Fredrick Nottingham (HAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/10/1984, off Joe Cureton (PEN)...
Injured on 5/6/1984 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1984...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1987, hitting .385 with 4 HR, 24 RBI...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/30/1987, hitting .563 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 7/7/1987...
Won World Championship with Ashburn in 1987...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1988, hitting .542 with 3 HR, 4 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/21/1989, hitting .462 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Ashburn on 2/7/1990 to a 4-year deal worth $5,800,100 per year...
Had 6 hits with 2 RBI against Halifax on 5/22/1991...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1991, hitting .607 with 4 HR, 7 RBI...
Had 22-game hitting streak snapped on 6/13/1991...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Plum Grove on 9/7/1991...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Capital City on 4/16/1992...
Was selected to the 1992 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Halifax on 8/16/1992...
